channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024120065
item.description:
Report E-2024120065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1760 2204 Descaler-Acid Pickle release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the poly tote lid due to a crack in the top of the tote. The material was gravity fed from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbents and PPE into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2024111057
item.description:
Report X-2024111057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-19
  • City: Saint-Louis
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Manager I Kayla Stangel contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Kayla stated that when they opened the door to trailer 89279, they noticed a pallet containing (1) crushed box of UN1426. Kayla stated that the box leaked 1-ounce of liquid on top of the carboard dunnage. Kayla stated t hat she is unsure how the box became crushed but stated that the box was marked damage upon unload at the 034/SCH facility. Kayla stated that no storm drains or waterways were impacted. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Rosa Gutierrez. Safety requested CURA to provide the inner packaging of the b ox and the Quantity Held. EWI personnel noted two (2) one quart damaged cans of UN1426 with approximately 0.25 gallon of product released to the cardboard
